page.title: 01Easton, Hacheston and Parham
page.content: Block 06280258 is a rural area containing three villages. The land is undulating,rising to about 100ft above sea level. Land use is primarily agricultural, mainly arable farmland with some grazing and some horticulture. Population is sparse except where concentrated in the three villages. Most people work on the land, but an increasing number travel to Ipswich, Woodbridge and Martlesham to work. The school at Parham with about 25 pupils is closing in 1986 and children will travel to Eston or Framlingham. Rural villages in Suffolk suffer from lack of amenities, shops and post offices close as the vast majority of the population have cars which they take to larger towns where the shops have cheaper goods.The shop and Post Office at Parham have closed within the last 10 years.
